summary: The Federal Employee Return to Work Act prohibits certain federal employees who telework a significant portion of the week from receiving annual pay adjustments. This applies to employees teleworking at least one day per week, with exceptions for those with disabilities, Foreign Service members, law enforcement, members of the Armed Forces, and those whose official worksite isn't defined by a specific regulation.  Affected employees will receive pay based on the 'Rest of U.S.' locality pay area, which will not be adjusted. The Act takes effect the first day of the fiscal year following enactment.
